definition: history genre based on biography, such as Sima Qian's Record of the Historian
surname Ji/also pr. [Ji4]
order/discipline/age/era/period/to chronicle
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
biography/historical narrative/commentaries/relay station
body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)

sentences.english: Shi Ji is a first general history of China by chronology.
sentences.chinese: 《史记》是中国第一部纪传体通史。

sentences.english: ShiJi is the first book of The General History in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 《史记》是中国历史上第一部纪传体通史。

definition: in the style of annals/chronological history, the regular form of the Chinese dynastic histories
historical biography
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
twenty four dynastic histories (or 25 or 26 in modern editions)
narrative history/comprehensive history/a history covering an extended period

A Mirror for the Wise Ruler (or Comprehensive Mirror for Aid in Government), a vast chronological general history, written by 司馬光|司马光[Si1 ma3 Guang1] Sima Guang (1019-1089) and collaborators during the Northern Song in 1084, covering the period 403 BC-959 AD, 294 scrolls
historical biography
novel in chapters, main format for long novels from the Ming onwards, with each chapter headed by a summary couplet
biographic sketch of an emperor
the Twenty-Four Histories (25 or 26 in modern editions), collection of books on Chinese dynastic history from 3000 BC till 17th century/fig. a long and complicated story
national history/dynastic history
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
style (of literature)/form

Three Commentaries on the Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], including Mr Gongyang's annals 公羊傳|公羊传[Gong1 yang2 Zhuan4], Mr Guliang's annals 穀梁傳|谷梁传[Gu3 liang2 Zhuan4] and Mr Zuo's annals or Zuo Zhuan 左傳|左传[Zuo3 Zhuan4]
the 24 or 25 official dynastic histories/true history, as opposed to fictional adaptation or popular legends
history book
